ygData.subject: H3 HTML Extractor missing URLs in certain conditional comments.
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi All, It seems the current H3 HTML Extractor is missing URLs in a conditional comments edge case. If you go to the page:

Subject: H3 HTML Extractor missing URLs in certain conditional comments.
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=119451900; y=g4ShSrYH8KtGc2PqOdGXEXcb7sET3scjgBURlQLhsYjUej9fovv5JHMA

Hi All,

It seems the current H3 HTML Extractor is missing URLs in a condit=
ional comments edge case. If you go to the page:

https://www.gov.uk/govern=
ment/publications

And view-source, you'll see a couple of lines like this:=


<!--[if gt IE 8]><!--><link href=3D"https://assets.digital.cabinet-office=
.gov.uk/government/assets/frontend/base-6ac393435b467a10daddb420a9047f96.cs=
s" media=3D"screen" rel=3D"stylesheet" type=3D"text/css">
<!--<![endif]--><=
link href=3D"https://assets.digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk/government/assets=
/frontend/print-2a796b79ee60efe43ef19f5442dce9ef.css"...

In this case, the=
 first link is missed by the HTML extractor, while the second works just fi=
ne. Over the whole page, three URLs are missed when the extraction runs, an=
d it seems to be correlated with this particular style of conditional comme=
nt: e.g. <!--[if gt IE 8]><!--> etc.

Has anyone else seen this? Are there =
any known solutions? We are in touch with them, so is there a more 'standar=
d' syntax we could suggest?

Thanks,

Andy Jackson
